column1: Writing to Charlotte and Denis Plimmer on 8 February 1967
column2: Tolkien says that he has been "recently deeply engaged in the books" of Renault
column3: and mentions in particular her works ''[[Wikipedia:The King Must Die|The King Must Die]]'' and ''[[Wikipedia:The Bull from the Sea|The Bull from the Sea]]'' (both about [[Wikipedia:Theseus|Theseus]]). Tolkien also tells the Plimmers that Renault has written Tolkien a card of appreciation
column4: "perhaps the piece of 'Fan-mail' that gives me most pleasure".<ref>{{L|294|2}}</ref> And writing to his secretary [[Joy Hill]] on 25 August 1967
